reference.shortdesc: An unordered is a list of items in which the order of list items is not significant.

section.title: Formatting expectations
section.p: Although rendering is left to the implementations, processors typically use the following conventions:

ul.li: List items are styled with a bullet character.
Different bullet or typographic chanracters are used to indicate the depth of the nesting.

section.title: Attributes
section.p: The following attributes are available on this element: , , , and .

example.title: Example
example.codeblock:
• This is an item in an unordered list.
  • To separate it from other items in the list, the formatter puts a bullet beside it.
  • The following paragraph, contained in the list item element, is part of the list item which contains it.

    This is the contained paragraph.

  • This is the last list item in our unordered list.
